{{cpp/utility/basic_stacktrace/title | max_size}}
{{cpp/utility/basic_stacktrace/navbar}}
{{ddcl | since=c++23 |
size_type max_size() const noexcept;
}}

Returns the maximum number of elements the underlying container (typically a {{lc|std::vector}}) is able to hold due to system or library implementation limitations, i.e. {{c|std::distance(begin(), end())}} for the largest underlying container.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
Maximum number of elements.

===Complexity===
Constant.

===Notes===
This value typically reflects the theoretical limit on the size of the underlying container, at most {{c|std::numeric_limits&lt;difference_type&gt;::max()}}. At runtime, the size of the container may be limited to a value smaller than {{tt|max_size()}} by the amount of RAM available.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;stacktrace&gt;

int main()
{
    std::stacktrace trace;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Maximum size of a 'basic_stacktrace' is " &lt;&lt; trace.max_size() &lt;&lt; "\n";
}
|p=true
|output=Maximum size of a 'basic_stacktrace' is 1152921504606846975
}}
